clinical_study.brief_title: Timing of Preload Responsiveness in Sepsis
clinical_study.official_title: Timing of Preload Responsiveness in Sepsis and Septic Shock

collaborator.agency: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock:
During acute circulatory failure, volume expansion does not always lead to a significant increase in cardiac output (fluid responsiveness). After initial resuscitation by rapid fluid administration, cardiac preload is no longer extremely low and only half of the patients respond to further volume expansion with the expected increase in cardiac output (fluid unresponsiveness). However, the time delay or the volume of fluid needed to be administered from the state of fluid responsiveness to fluid unresponsiveness is still not determined.
Objective To determine, in critically ill patients with acute circulatory failure,
1. : the time and/or the volume of fluid needed from the state of fluid responsiveness to fluid unresponsiveness during septic shock.
2. : determine the factors that influence this time and volume.

primary_outcome.measure: The time delay from the state of fluid responsiveness to fluid unresponsiveness
primary_outcome.time_frame: 60 minutes after the evaluation of fluid responsiveness
primary_outcome.description: At the time of inclusion, the investigators use the tests available (fluid challenge, passive leg raising, end-expiratory occlusion test) to evaluate the presence of fluid responsiveness, and after one hour, the investigators repeat the test and to re-evaluate the presence of fluid responsiveness until the patient is no longer present the fluid responsiveness.

primary_outcome.measure: The volume of fluid needed from the state of fluid responsiveness to fluid unresponsiveness
primary_outcome.description: If the fluid challenge is performed, the volume of each time for the fluid administration should be noted until the patient is no longer fluid-responsive, then the investigators can calculate the total amount of the fluid administrated.

secondary_outcome.measure: The risk factors for the time delay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the factors that may influence the time delay from the state of fluid responsiveness to fluid unresponsiveness

secondary_outcome.measure: The risk factors for the volume of fluid needed from the state of fluid responsiveness to fluid
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the factors that may influence the volume of fluid administrated from the state of fluid responsiveness to fluid unresponsiveness

study_pop.textblock: The patients who just arrive at the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) for septic shock need to be quickly resuscitated.
